newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria air force evacuates 250 from Sierra Leone.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria air force evacuates 250 from Sierra Leone.

text.p: The Nigerian air force has flown home 250 people, mostly Nigerians affected by civil strife in Sierra Leone following a coup there two weeks ago, state-owned News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reported on Saturday.
The returnees, mostly businessmen, arrived in the capital Abuja on Thursday and were handed over to unprepared officials of the national emergency relief agency, NAN said.
"We were not aware that they were coming until about eight hours after their arrival and so we could not make prior arrangements for them," it quoted one relief official as saying.

The returnees have been accommodated at a youth transit camp in a suburb of Abuja and the non-Nigerians among them handed over to the local office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees.
The coup by junior officers in Sierra Leone on May 25 toppled the elected president, Ahmad Tejan Kabbah, and Nigeria is in the forefront of a campaign to restore him to power.

But the shelling of Freetown by Nigerian gunboats in a show of force last Monday failed make an impact on the coup makers who responded by naming their own ruling council and saying they would not reinstate Kabbah.
Nigeria's next move is not clear but the commander of a West African force assembled in Freetown to deal with the situation is in Abuja to meet Nigerian army ruler General Sani Abacha.
